Erik Wilde: Getting APIs to Work: Creating and Managing Valuable API Landscapes

(2) Summary

There's no doubt that APIs are a key ingredient in any digitalization and digital transformation initiative. Balancing the efforts of the various aspects of API platforms and programs, however, can be a tricky thing. There are technical aspects regarding individual API designs, API management, and the API platform. Then there are business aspects when it comes to making sure that you're building the right APIs and that everybody acquires an API mindset in terms of designing and building API products. And then there are organizational aspects of making sure that team structures and practices take advantage of APIs, and making sure that the right stakeholders are involved at the right moment throughout the API lifecycle. Balancing all these bits and pieces is a complex task and we'll spend some time looking at the individual bits and pieces, relating them so that we can better understand what may be holding us back and where we should invest. This workshop is intended for developers who want to better understand the bigger picture of the API program and platform they're working with, API program and platform managers who want to get a better idea of how to balance their efforts, and business leaders who want a detailed look at how to manage the fabric that can make or break their digital transformation initiative.
